column4: I'm dual booting Ubuntu and FreeBSD, but I need to add FreeBSD to the GRUB menu, anyone know how?
yes it's rather easy really just haev to remember the third part of the devices and such
copy the Ubuntu entry that is there but you need to change root so it goes liek root (hdX, a) for the root part and the kernel is /boot/loader
ok, well I actually just wrote over the Fedora I had installed with FreeBSD, so would I just rename the Fedora entry to 'FreeBSD' and leave the rest alone?
no you need to edit root and the kernel lines
what does the root line say for the old fedora lin
(hd0,2) - I also have openSuse installed on (hd0,1)
well it would be root (hd0,a)
and the kerne;l line should read /boot/loader
ok, so change it to (hd0,a), and the kernel to '/boot/loader' and that's it?
pretty much :) jsut be glad your not usuing grub on FreeBSD itself it's a bit different for that
haha, ok, well I'll give it a try and reboot :) thanks!
nope, "bad file or directory type"
opps forgot another thing
root (hd0,2,a) :) been a while sicne I setup grub for freebsd sicne I just use freebsd without a bootloader
ok, thanks :)
ok, will try again :)
nope, still "Error 2: Bad File or Entry type"
well you need to figure out what's wrong since if it's on the second partition it should be hd0,2 but the a could be different
well first partition is Ubuntu (hd0,0), openSuse is second partition (hd0,1), and BSD should be 3rd partition (hd0,2) right?
correct for my system I would use hd0,0,a for my root line
nope, no spaces in there
it's "(hd0,2,a)"
